titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for a clinic to be conducted by the United States Luge Association.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings, Hazardous Materials and Pipeline Transportation.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 106-171.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 65.

action.text: Mr. Cooksey moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 91.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration.

committee.subcommittee: Economic Development, Public Buildings, Hazardous Materials and Pipeline Transportation
committee.name: House Transportation and Infrastructure

bill.summary: 6/14/1999--Passed House amended. Authorizes the U.S. Luge Association to sponsor a free public clinic on the Capitol Grounds on August 14, 1999.
